alert.note: Alert for Austin; Colorado; Fort Bend; Wharton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 07 at 8:35PM CDT until April 10 at 9:01PM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Houston/Galveston TX has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas... San Bernard River Near East Bernard affecting Colorado, Wharton, Austin and Fort Bend Counties. For the San Bernard River...including East Bernard...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON TO LATE MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...San Bernard River Near East Bernard. * WHEN...From Saturday afternoon to late Monday evening. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding begins in the vicinity of the gage with minor roads along the river inundated. Backwater flooding up Britt Branch and Bratcher Slough begins. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM CDT Friday the stage was 11.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow afternoon to a crest of 17.9 feet Sunday morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Monday morning. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 18.0 feet on 07/07/2007. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Mon San Bernard River East Bernard 17.0 11.5 Fri 8 pm CDT 17.3 17.7 16.4 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday morning at 845 AM CDT.
